headers.subject: Re: [PHP] Moving a PHP/MySQL web site ???
headers.received: from unknown (HELO pulsator.com) (212.124.64.67) by pb1.pair.com with SMTP; 27 Jul 2001 14:35:39 -0000

body.para:
I think that as far as you have the same version of MySQL on both servers, you
can simply copy the table files, otherwise you should use mysqldump or something
like that

quote.quotepara: ----- Original Message ----- From: "PHP Junkie" <php091565@netscape.net> To: <php-general@lists.php.net> Sent: Friday 27 July 2001 ?. 5:21 PM Subject: [PHP] Moving a PHP/MySQL web site ???

I will be having to face the dubious task of moving my PHP/MySQL-based website
to another server. Can anyone out there point me to some "GOOD" documentation on
this? The .php files I'm not as concerned about. I've been using the
$DOCUMENT_ROOT in all of my includes. I'm more concerned about getting the MySQL
databases ( actual files ??? ) moved over correctly.

I know this isn't a MySQL list, but I thought that enough of you out there work
with PHP/MySQL enough to get some good feedback. I'd also like to hear feedback
on just your general experience with the process of moving from one web server
over to another.
Gene Kelley BizFlow Data Solutions http://www.bizflowdata.net/
